tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE location_histories (
  user_id UUID,
  location_name VARCHAR(255),
  latitude DECIMAL,
  longitude DECIMAL,
  visit_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE travel_routes (
  route_id INT,
  user_id INT,
  starting_location VARCHAR(255),
  ending_location VARCHAR(255),
  travel_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE user_locations (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_name VARCHAR,
    latitude FLOAT,
    longitude FLOAT,
    visit_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE user_routes (
    route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    start_location VARCHAR,
    end_location VARCHAR,
    route_description TEXT,
    route_distance FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE user_activities (
    activity_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    activity_name VARCHAR,
    activity_date DATE,
    activity_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE user_locations (
    user_id INT,
    location_id INT,
    visited_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (location_id) REFERENCES locations(location_id)
);

CREATE TABLE routes (
    route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    start_location_id INT,
    end_location_id INT,
    route_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (start_location_id) REFERENCES locations(location_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (end_location_id) REFERENCES locations(location_id)
);

CREATE TABLE UserLocations (
  user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  location_name VARCHAR(255),
  latitude DECIMAL,
  longitude DECIMAL,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE UserTravelRoutes (
  route_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id UUID REFERENCES UserLocations(user_id),
  start_location VARCHAR(255),
  end_location VARCHAR(255),
  route_duration INTERVAL
);
